channel.title: Community Member/Vet
channel.description: I've been here for 2 years, 10 months, and 28 day which is equal to 1,062 days, or 25,488 hours, or 1,529,280 minutes and 91,756,800 seconds. Pretty long time, longer than most of the Moparscape Mods. So I was wondering, how do I become a community member/veteran?

item.title: Community Member/Vet
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

You have to be nominated by a veteran. Then voted on by the other 40 veterans. I personally would not nominate you; and time of registration means nothing.

Read full topic

item.title: Community Member/Vet
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

This thread is homosexual.

Basically, if you are not a moron, contribute something valuable to the community and not act like a total prat about your intelligence, the veterans are more likely to vote you in. It’s a position where other vets want you to be part of the group, not the other way round which seems like your attitude.

Community member is awarded to members that have 50 rep on mitb and then hand picked by the admins as someone that deserved that rep. There are quite a lot of members with well over 50 rep that do not hold the position due to that individual not being suitable for the title.

tl;dr:
time since registering is certainly not a factor.

Read full topic

^ Just goes to prove your amount of time here doesn’t mean shit.
[/quote]

I think he gets the point…

after being told by almost everyone in this topic lol[/quote]Maybe so, BUT I WANNA BITCH AND COMPLAIN NOW lololol

[/quote]

Why don’t you look here?

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

That link goes to prove that being a veteran or a moderator does not make you mature in any way![/quote]Heh, maybe not when it’s a topic that isn’t a serious matter. But another thing a vet needs to know how to program, just sayin =)

item.title: Community Member/Vet
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“Echo_, post:52, topic:378658”]Time definitely doesn’ t matter, just check out this dude’ s profile. He has been here since 06 and is still a Senior Member.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


We also have people who joined the site and had vet like 2 weeks later (AuraDevil iirc). It all goes on how you contribute to the community. Just like every other position on this site, how long you’ve been here means absolutely nothing.

I’m not saying that you posted this trying to get vet/cm, but the ranks really don’t mean anything. There are people with both ranks that really shouldn’t, and I know the vet section (up until recently) completely dead. I’m sure the same goes for the CM section(s) too.

Read full topic

item.title: Community Member/Vet
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

I’m guessing a lot of the current Veterans were not trying for the status, they just contributed what they knew which got them recognised. If you’re not releasing anything spectacular, you’ll go unnoticed. If you post a thread like this, chances are you will annoy the Veterans (the ones that actually have to vote you in…). Releasing c&p or add-on tutorials for messy gameservers such as I think DELTA and PI are the tags I see filling most of the tutorial section, don’t show anything knowledge-wise. Though there are exceptions in every case, I’m sure if you designed something amazing for any framework it would benefit the community.

Read full topic
